page.title: 05COMMONS AROUND SOUTH REIGATE
page.content: To the east of the area lie Redhill Common(300 acres)which rises to 150 metres above sea level giving fine views to the North Downs,south to Leith Hill and over Redhill,and Earls- wood Common(52 acres), favourite camp- ing ground for "Travelling People." Redhill Common and Earlswood Common are separated by the graceful spire of St. John's Church,and were originally quarried for road-mending stone.Be- tween Earlswood Common and Petridge Wood Common lie the sewage works and rubbish dump with its sophisticated but inoperable capital equipment! In the north east corner of the area lie Reigate Park and Reigate Priory together covering 155 acres. There is a large lake with water fowl. There are fine views from the ridge known as Park Hill which has a reser- voir at the east end.
